cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi (40 km) SSW of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, emerge into the north-western Caribbean on Friday, then accelerate north-northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast (Louisiana–Mississippi area).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana/Mississippi border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect for Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua, to Punta Castilla, Honduras.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Caribbean coast of Nicaragua and Honduras (no U.S. coast warnings yet).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the Florida Panhandle is shown inside the 5-day cone.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible at the port late Saturday night into Sunday; hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out if Nate strengthens faster than forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3–6 ft above normal tides possible along the southeast Louisiana coast, including lower Mississippi River and port approaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Sunday into early Monday with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; temporary channel closure and reduced visibility from heavy squalls.
